newsitem.title: ISRAEL: US navy aircraft missing off Israel.
newsitem.headline: US navy aircraft missing off Israel.

text.p: A U.S. navy aircraft with four crew went missing on Tuesday night while on a routine training exercise off Israel, the U.S. embassy in Israel said on Wednesday.

"The aircraft, with four crew members aboard, was conducting a routine training exercise off the coast of Israel when it disappeared from radar at 19:56 local (1756 GMT)," the United States Information Service said in a press release, quoting the U.S. Sixth Fleet.

It said rescue crews were searching in the Mediterranean for the S-3B Viking aircraft, which disappeared about 140 kms (90 miles) west of Haifa after it took off from the USS Theodore Roosevelt aircraft carrier.
The statement said the aircraft is assigned to the Naval Air Station Cecil Field in Jacksonville Florida.
